snippet: The Detroit carmakers posted double-digit increases in sales for the year as December finished with a flourish.
abstract: American automakers in 2011 sold about 12.8 million vehicles, their best year since 2008; sales rose 8.7 percent in December, and increased 10 percent for year compared with 2010; analysts say that even with increased demand, carmakers will be hard-pressed to maintain their combined 47 market share, up from 45 percent in 2010, against foreign companies.
lead_paragraph: The Detroit carmakers posted double-digit increases in sales for the year as December finished with a flourish.

headline.main: Good Year for Autos, but a Test Waits in ’12
headline.print_headline: Good Year For Autos, But a Test Waits in ’12
